intro: Stephanotrichum octonum, commonly known as the eight-flowered stephanotrichum, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetlands and along streambanks, thriving in moist, sandy soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, with white to pale yellow petals, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits called cypsela. Stephanotrichum octonum is often found in wetland habitats and is an important component of the local flora.
